description.narrative: Thematic objectives: -Governance standards enhanced by right-holders and duty-bearers -Economic opportunities for young men and women improved

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: CSOs and other detention monitoring bodies have capacity to support torture prevention Detention monitoring mechanisms and CSOs in at least two of the target countries adopt specialized strategies and approaches

target.value: 1. In at least one target country, a detention monitoring body / prison health institution has strengthened the capacity of its monitors / staff on the role of prison health in preventing torture and ill-treatment in detention. 2. In at least one target country, a CSO national monitoring body has secured a MoU with the relevant authorities granting the body access to places of detention. 3. A thematic report on pre-trial detention covering four countries in the MENA region is published and is being used as a tool for advocacy by CSO partners.

actual.value: 1) Fulfilled - Marocco 2) Fulfilled - Tunisia 3) Not fulfilled

target.value: 1. In at least one target country, health monitoring is an integral part of the training curriculum offered to new monitors. 2. In at least one target country, negotiations are underway with the relevant authorities to grant access to a CSO monitoring body to conduct preventive monitoring visits to places of detention. 3. At the regional level, the MENA Regional Forum for monitoring places of detention and prevention of torture is active (have gathered data and analysed for fact-sheets/report).

actual.value: 1) Fulfilled - Tunisia have reached various agreements with the state on accessing places of detention for regular monitoring visit and not only trainings. 2) Fulfilled - Negotiations continue to reach also police stations and to increase impact via joint monitoring visits. 3) Fulfilled - In January 2018 a scientific article on the effects of narrative exposure therapy (NET) in the MENA region was published in ‘Torture Journal’ in which all centres participated and acted as co-authors.

target.value: 1 target country has health monitoring integrated. negotiations on access takes place. and regional exchanges on prevention take place.

actual.value: First two targets fulfilled, and third target mainly fulfilled.

target.value: 1 target country can train on health monitoring health. agreements on access are reached. and a regional study on access inform advocacy

actual.value: In Morocco, a new cohort of 26 prison staff from all sectors were trained on national policy and manual. This brings the total to 36 Master Trainers who went on to reach 195 prison staff in 2020 across seven prisons through full-day training sessions. In a separate initiative funded by DAPP and linked to the positive achievements under 2.4. in 2020, the DGAPR collaborated with DIGNITY and the University of Mohamed Ben Abdallah (USMBA, Fez, Morocco) in conducting a study on the impact of covid-19 on prison staff in 4 prisons across the country.

target.value: n at least one target country, a detention monitoring body / prison health institution has strengthened the capacity of its monitors / staff on the role of prison health in preventing torture and ill-treatment in detention. 2. In at least one target country, a CSO national monitoring body has secured a MoU with the relevant authorities granting the body access to places of detention. 3. A thematic report on pre-trial detention covering four countries in the MENA region is published and is being used as a tool for advocacy by CSO partners.
1 target country have fully institutionalized health monitoring. and 1 country has a CSO monitoring body with access. and regional tools and strategies exists

title.narrative: Human rights defenders (HRDs) strengthened through partnerships in civil society. Pressure on human rights defenders and organizations is eased, and their actions consolidated or sustained at the local, national and regional level

target.value: 40 individual HRDs and their families receive urgent protection support and 60 right groups and NGOs are strengthened
40 individual HRDs and their families receive urgent protection support and 60 right groups and NGOs are strengthened

Annual outcomes (ref. Outcome Harvesting) reflect in different ways that: ? Policy makers and authorities acknowledge the credibility of HROs and HRDs ? Agendas and Policies reflect inputs from HRDC/EuroMed Rights and partners ? Procedures and practices reflect from HRDC/EuroMed Rights and partners
120 individual HRDs and their families receive urgent protection support and 180 human rights groups and NGOs are strengthened.
EuroMed Rights and its members are engaged in advocacy in many countries in the region with a focus on the topics and themes of its regional and national working groups

actual.value: Over the full period, 103 outcomes have been achieved

title.narrative: Human rights standards enhanced through partnerships with duty bearers and national human rights institutions (NHRIs).

1. Capacity development in treaty-based reporting with states 2. Partnerships with NHRIs to strengthen their independent role; 3. Academic co-operation and exchange involving young persons, 4. Capacity building of justice sector agents in Jordan on the prevention of torture.

target.value: 1. At least two improved governmental human rights reporting processes 2. At least two NHRIs are capable of fulfilling their mandate. 3. Confessions under torture get rejected. and investigations are opened.

title.narrative: Implementation of torture preventive measures improved through partnerships with government institutions and civil society.

Implementation of torture preventive measures improved through partnerships with government institutions and civil society.
1. New laws and institutional procedures changed practice towards improved prevention of torture in places of detention. 2. Overall technical capacity and awareness among key stakeholders on rehabilitation treatment and reduction of levels of urban violence.

target.value: 1. Legal frameworks and changed practices support the prevention of torture (in progress countries) as internal regulations and guideline are developed. 2. Share of torture survivors who receive support for rehabilitation and redress has increased by 50%

title.narrative: Human rights defenders (HRDs) strengthened through partnerships in civil society
Pressure on human rights defenders and organizations is eased, and their actions consolidated or sustained at the local, national and regional level

target.value: At least 1100 HROs or HRDs have strengthened capacity to address human rights violations and inequalities and to advance human rights reforms annually.

title.narrative: Religious dialogue improved through partnerships with religious leaders, media, academia and intercultural platforms in the region

Religious dialogue improved through partnerships with religious leaders, media, academia and intercultural platforms in the regionA minimum of 850 key actors has gained skills, tools, knowledge, relationships and networks to initiate and conduct improved religious dialogue.

target.value: The number and outreach of key actors increased and a minimum of 850 new key actors have improved their understanding and use of religious dialogue.

title.narrative: The capacity for inter-institutional cooperation between national human rights institutions has been systematically enhanced in at least two countries and across the region.

target.value: 2 NHRIs have established one plan each incl. organisation. administration. resources. training needs and intended action
At least 2 NHRI's have established a strategy and action plan and conducted several inclusive reporting processes.
2 NHRIs have implemented plans. and perform in accordance with mandates
2 Key duty-bearers and representatives of rights-holders regularly collaborate to pursue dialogue about the realization of international human rights standards in law and in practice

actual.value: Partly met. Tunisia: On target Jordan: On target Morocco: On target Algeria: On target Egypt: DIHR decided to stop its engagement in Egypt

target.value: 2 NHRIs have developed mandates and capacity.

actual.value: Partly met. Tunisia: on target. Jordan: on target. Egypt: no progress. Morocoo: limited progress.

target.value: 1 At least one National Human Rights Institution has established a strategic and action plan for fulfilling the mandate.

actual.value: The Tunisian NHRI has agreed on a strategic plan

target.value: The mandates and function of NHRIs require clarification and upgrading

title.narrative: 195 key actors enhance interfaith networks via 5 platforms and 3 partnerships. Participants have improved their understanding and use of religious dialogue and human rights standards

target.value: Sustain and enhance alumni networks among a minimum of 85 young and religious leaders and religiously engaged actors across the MENA and Denmark.
Completion of three interfaith conferences. nine local initiatives that promote and improve religious dialogue between DK and the MENA.
Completion of a minimum of three interfaith conferences, followed by a minimum of nine local initiatives that promote and improve religious dialogue and partnership in and between DK and the MENA.
195 key actors have improved their understanding and use of religious dialogue via the 5 platforms
3 Completion of three interfaith conferences. nine local initiatives that promote and improve religious dialogue between DK and the MENA.

actual.value: So far, the key actors have been directly engaged in the work through two bigger interfaith conferences and local encounters in 2017 and 2018 as well as two smaller conferences and local encounters in 2019 and 2020. Moreover, 10 local initiatives that promote and improve religious dialogue and partnership in and between DK and the MENA have been conducted

target.value: Sustain and enhance alumni networks among a minimum of 85 young and religious leaders and religiously engaged actors across the MENA and Denmark.
